intro: Ononis natrix var. virgata, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, often shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its roots are fibrous and help stabilize soil, making it a valuable species in ecological restoration projects.
